intro: Hordeum maritimum var. gussoneanum, commonly known as the Mediterranean wild barley, is a perennial grass species native to coastal regions of the Mediterranean. It thrives in saline and sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to harsh coastal environments. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences. Its leaves are narrow and hairy, and the seeds are enclosed in small, tough husks. This variety is of interest to botanists and ecologists due to its resilience and ecological significance in coastal ecosystems.
